segment.source: Exercise 1 - Identify Problems with Spurious Wakes
segment.target: Exercise 1 - Identify Problems with Spurious Wakes

segment.source: Devices should avoid unexpectedly waking up the SoC through interrupts (for example, interrupt storms, bad debouncing, etc.).
segment.target: Devices should avoid unexpectedly waking up the SoC through interrupts (for example, interrupt storms, bad debouncing, etc.).

segment.source: Exercise 1 - Identify Problems with Spurious Wakes
segment.target: Exercise 1 - Identify Problems with Spurious Wakes

segment.source: Devices should avoid unexpectedly waking up the SoC through interrupts (for example, interrupt storms, bad debouncing, etc.).
segment.target: Devices should avoid unexpectedly waking up the SoC through interrupts (for example, interrupt storms, bad debouncing, etc.).

segment.source: Waking up the SoC causes the system to exit DRIPS, increases the average power floor and reduces battery life.
segment.target: Waking up the SoC causes the system to exit DRIPS, increases the average power floor and reduces battery life.

segment.source: This is known as a spurious wake.
segment.target: This is known as a spurious wake.

segment.source: The analysis process related to spurious wakes is fairly straightforward.
segment.target: The analysis process related to spurious wakes is fairly straightforward.

segment.source: Download the pre-generated sleepstudy-report1.html report here.
segment.target: Download the pre-generated sleepstudy-report1.html report here.

segment.source: Open sleepstudy-report1.html with your favorite browser.
segment.target: Open sleepstudy-report1.html with your favorite browser.

segment.source: The system consumes 1.818 Watts of energy during 19 hours and the DRIPS % is 92%.
segment.target: The system consumes 1.818 Watts of energy during 19 hours and the DRIPS % is 92%.

segment.source: Look at the Top Offenders table.
segment.target: Look at the Top Offenders table.

segment.source: The networking wireless device is listed as active 7% of the time during the session.
segment.target: The networking wireless device is listed as active 7% of the time during the session.

segment.source: Click on the networking device row to obtain details about this offender.
segment.target: Click on the networking device row to obtain details about this offender.

segment.source: Spurious wakes are clearly identified by the report.
segment.target: Spurious wakes are clearly identified by the report.

segment.source: There are 80 of them in this example.
segment.target: There are 80 of them in this example.

segment.source: A follow-up discussion should happen with the IHV to determine why the wireless adapter is waking up the SoC unexpectedly.
segment.target: A follow-up discussion should happen with the IHV to determine why the wireless adapter is waking up the SoC unexpectedly.

segment.source: The underlying problem could be a bad device firmware implementation.
segment.target: The underlying problem could be a bad device firmware implementation.
